description.translate: Te whakahohe i te reo me te tirohanga o te hunga hauā

children.text: We believe and are focused on
Identifying, addressing and reducing inequities in health, social and life outcomes for people with disabilities.
Increasing the voices and perspectives of disabled people to be enabled and heard.
Increasing assistance for people with disabilities and their whanau to access and understand the disability support system and requirements.
Undertaking research and investigation into disability so that disability rights is encouraged, stimulated and aided
To establish partnerships with other entities to achieve the Trust's purposes

My Life My Voice is a charitable trust providing disability support that is disabled-person led. Our staff consists of a Business Manager, a Tuhono / Connector and contracted Peer Connectors from the Ministry of Health. We offer meaningful support, information and connections that assist disable people and their whanau to plan for, and have, their good life.
Our Board is made up of Gerri Pomeroy, Dr Tristram Ingham, Bernadette Jones and Joanne Decomber. (Opportunity to profile board members at a later date / upon getting content for profiles).
My Life My Voice is a collaboration between Muscular Dystrophy Association (Tuaatara / Central Region) and Disabled Persons Assembly, both who are dedicated to the rights of people with disabilities.

common.mainNavHome: Taku Ao Taku Reo - Haere ki te whaarangi
common.404Para: Te ahua nei kei te ngaro tenei whaarangi.
common.inputReadPolicies1: Kua panuihia e au, kua maarama, kua whakaae hoki ki nga
common.inputReadPolicies3: Mo Taku Ora Taku Reo i mua i te tuku mai i tenei pepa.
common.submitContent: Kua riro i a maatau to pakirehua ka hoki wawe mai ano ki a koe.
common.submitContentError: Te ahua nei i raru te rironga mai o te pepa i to maatau mutunga.
